title: Cowboys, Green Beans, and Jaguars
teaser:
In this hour, a severely stuttering child years later becomes the world's premier jaguar expert. Plus, a Texas tale of moon pies and bedazzlers;  the surprising story of a Harlem man who ends up at a rodeo in Oregon; and one father's way of coping with a son who loves the color pink.

The Moth's Artistic Director, Catherine Burns, hosts.
description: Alan Rabinowitz – “Man and Beast”: The stuttering jaguar expert who talks to animals. Faye Lane – “Green Bean Queen”: The tale of a young girl growing up in a Texan beauty salon. Rudy Rush – “Harlem Cowboy”: A Harlem man is out of his element at the rodeo. James Braly – “Pink Bicycle”: Coping with the color pink and the son who loves it.  The Moth's Artistic Director, Catherine Burns, hosts.
contentencoded:
Alan Rabinowitz – “Man and Beast”: The stuttering jaguar expert who talks to animals.
Faye Lane – “Green Bean Queen”: The tale of a young girl growing up in a Texan beauty salon.
Rudy Rush – “Harlem Cowboy”: A Harlem man is out of his element at the rodeo.
James Braly – “Pink Bicycle”: Coping with the color pink and the son who loves it.

The Moth's Artistic Director, Catherine Burns, hosts.
